head.title: National Briefing | South: North Carolina: Appeal For Death-Row Inmate

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: North Carolina: Appeal For Death-Row Inmate

abstract.p: Lawyers for Ernest P McCarver, death-row inmate, will press US Supreme Court to hear his case to decide whether executing mentally retarded person is unconstitutional; state, which recently passed bill banning execution of mentally retarded, asks court dismiss appeal; is challenging assertion tha McCarver is mentally retarded (S)

block.p: Lawyers for Ernest P. McCarver, a death-row inmate, said they would continue to ask the Supreme Court to hear his case to decide the question of whether executing a mentally retarded person is unconstitutional. Mr. McCarver's I.Q. is 67, his lawyers say, and on Saturday, Gov. Michael F. Easley of North Carolina signed a bill banning the execution of the mentally retarded, those with I.Q.'s less than 70. On Monday, North Carolina asked the Supreme Court to dismiss the appeal. They plan to challenge the assertion that Mr. McCarver is mentally retarded.
